misconfigurations.scenario: users wants to automatically manage data storage tiers
misconfigurations.alert_criteria: s3 lifecycle manager is turned off; intelligent tiering is not enabled
misconfigurations.recommendation_action: turn on lifecycle manager

misconfigurations.scenario: users wants their data encrypted in their data lake
misconfigurations.alert_criteria: s3 object is not encrypted
misconfigurations.recommendation_action: encrypt object
misconfigurations.recommendation_description_detailed: we recommend encrypting objects if you are concerned about [risk reason 1, risk reason 2, risk reason... n]

misconfigurations.scenario: user wants to be made aware of the locations of all public s3 buckets (or their contents)
misconfigurations.alert_criteria: bucket or its subfolders are open to the public
misconfigurations.recommendation_action:
- Randomise your bucket names! There is no need to use company-backup.s3.amazonaws.com.
- Set appropriate permissions and audit regularly.  
- If possible create two buckets - one for your public assets and another for private data.
- Try Amazon Macie - it can automatically classify and secure sensitive data.

misconfigurations.scenario: S3 buckets storing infrequently accessed data in Standard storage class without lifecycle policies
misconfigurations.alert_criteria: S3 buckets with >30 days old objects in Standard storage class, no lifecycle policies configured, and low GET request rates
misconfigurations.recommendation_action: Implement S3 Lifecycle policies to transition objects to S3 Standard-IA (30+ days), Intelligent-Tiering, Glacier (90+ days), or Deep Archive (180+ days)
misconfigurations.recommendation_description_detailed: S3 storage costs can be reduced by 30-60% by implementing lifecycle policies to automatically transition objects to appropriate storage classes. Standard-IA saves ~45% for infrequently accessed data (30+ days), Glacier saves ~77% for archival (90+ days), and Glacier Deep Archive saves ~95% for long-term retention (180+ days). S3 Intelligent-Tiering automatically optimizes costs by moving objects between tiers. Lifecycle policies are free to implement with no transition fees within the same region.
misconfigurations.notes: AWS Well-Architected Framework - Organizations can reduce S3 costs by 30-60% with proper lifecycle management

metadata.source: AWS Well-Architected Framework Cost Optimization Pillar 2025

misconfigurations.scenario: user does not want s3 bucket to allow all actions from all principals
misconfigurations.alert_criteria: Condition detected: user does not want s3 bucket to allow all actions from all principals

user wants to:

- alow an ever changing list of users to download files by generating urls dynamically
- allow temporarily a user to upload a file to a precise location in our bucket
misconfigurations.alert_criteria:
Condition detected: user wants to: 
- allow only logged-in user to download a premium video on their s3 bucket
- alow an
misconfigurations.recommendation_action: generate presigned urls with SDK

misconfigurations.scenario: user states that they want to be able to recover deleted s3 objects immediately for a set time (15 days) athough it happens rarely. after the set time, and for up to a year, deleted objects should be recoverable within 48 hours.
misconfigurations.alert_criteria: Condition detected: user states that they want to be able to recover deleted s3 objects immediately for a set time (15 d
misconfigurations.recommendation_action: enable s3 versioning and transition "non-current" versions to s3IA; afterwards noncurrent versions can be moved to DEEP_ARCHIVE

misconfigurations.scenario: s3 performance dips
misconfigurations.alert_criteria: Condition detected: s3 performance dips
misconfigurations.recommendation_action:
- request quota increase
- change your encryption type (from KMS to something else) 
- do a multipart upload
- enable s3 transfer acceleration
misconfigurations.recommendation_description_detailed: in most normal cases, quotas will exceed requirements, however in some scenarios, such as using KMS encryption in a limited region on high usage, you may be throttled

misconfigurations.scenario: user wants to query s3 directly using simple, performant sql statements
misconfigurations.alert_criteria: Condition detected: user wants to query s3 directly using simple, performant sql statements
misconfigurations.recommendation_action: use s3 select
misconfigurations.recommendation_description_detailed: user should be able to filter by rows and colums, with less CPU cost client side

misconfigurations.scenario: user wants to do analysis / query s3 with complex sql statements (or using a BI related tool)
misconfigurations.alert_criteria: Condition detected: user wants to do analysis / query s3 with complex sql statements (or using a BI related tool)
misconfigurations.recommendation_action: use athena

misconfigurations.scenario: user wants to prevent any other user (including themselvs) from overwriting data; user is likely requiring a WORM (write once read many) policy

misconfigurations.recommendation_action: use cloudfront singed url
misconfigurations.recommendation_description_detailed: assumes the S3 bucket is secured to only exchange data with CloudFront
